text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Mizuma was born in Yamagata Prefecture on July 22, 1970. She played for Urawa Motobuto Ladies FC until 1992. In 1993, she moved to Asahi Kokusai Bunnys (later Takarazuka Bunnys). In 1995, she retired for injury. On September 9, 1990, when Mizuma was 20 years old, she debuted and scored a goal for the Japan national team against South Korea. She was a member of Japan for 1991 World Cup. She also played at 1990 Asian Games, 1991 and 1993 AFC Championship. She played 22 games and scored 10 goals for Japan until 1994. ==Statistics== Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 1990 5 3 1991 11 2 1992 0 0 1993 5 5 1994 1 0 Total 22 10 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1970 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Yamagata Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Bunnys Kyoto SC players Category:1991 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:1991 AFC Women's Championship players Category:1993 AFC Women's Championship players Category:Footballers at the 1990 Asian Games Category:Asian Games medalists in football Category:Asian Games silver medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 1990 Asian Games
title: Yuriko Mizuma
